intro: Calyptrogyne costatifrons, commonly known as the broad-leaved sea grape, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, succulent foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant thrives in saline and brackish environments, making it well adapted to coastal and estuarine habitats. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine, and it plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils. Calyptrogyne costatifrons is an important species for both ecological and economic reasons in its native range.
